com.npaul.mdreader.activities

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.npaul.mdreader.activities.MainActivity

  • public class MainActivity
extends Activity
    An activity where the user can choose a file to edit using a file browser
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Nathan Paul

      Opens a given file in the edit activity
      private void refreshFileList()
      Refreshes the file list and keeps the position in the file list to prevent the user from scrolling to the position they were in

      Called in onResume() to pick up any external changes in the filesystem

    • Method Detail

      • changeDirectory

        private void changeDirectory(String directory,
                   boolean isPrevious)
        Changes the directory to another and updates the file list as well
        Parameters:
        directory - the new directory to display
        isPrevious - whether the directory is a previous directory, and should not be added to the dirHistory stack

      • getFiles

        private ArrayList<File> getFiles(String DirectoryPath)
                          throws NullPointerException
        Gets the files in a given directory and returns them in an arraylist
        Parameters:
        DirectoryPath - the full path to the directory
        Returns:
        the file array, null if the directory is empty
        Throws:
        NullPointerException

      • initFileListView

        private void initFileListView()
        Updates the file list view in the UI and attaches a listener to each one

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

        public void onResume()

      • openFile

        private void openFile(File file)
        Opens a given file in the edit activity
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be opened

      • refreshFileList

        private void refreshFileList()
        Refreshes the file list and keeps the position in the file list to prevent the user from scrolling to the position they were in

        Called in onResume() to pick up any external changes in the filesystem
